sections.title: Make Time Work for You
sections.subtitle: How compound interest accelerates savings growth

sections.title: Compounding Basics
sections.content: Compound interest means interest earns interest. The earlier you start, the more time magnifies your results.

points.title: Start Early
points.description: Even small amounts grow meaningfully over time.

points.title: Stay Consistent
points.description: Regular contributions beat sporadic large ones.

points.title: Avoid Interruptions
points.description: Withdrawals hurt compounding; keep your savings intact.

sections.title: Example
sections.content: Save $100/month at 4% APY for 10 years ≈ $14,700 vs $12,000 contributed.

sections.title: Pro Tip
sections.content: Raise your savings by 1–2% every six months to accelerate growth.
